intro: Quercus breedloveana, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its white to pale gray bark and lobed leaves. The tree produces acorns, which are a food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows in dry to moist forests and is adapted to a range of soil types. Its ecological importance makes it a significant component of its native habitat.
